result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person with Attorney Poss.  This case was dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes in 13CF203.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared through Attorney Poss.  Case resolved.  Set for plea/sentencing.

Waive reading of the information.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by the court.  STC set for 1/25/16 at 3 pm
Information filed.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Court questioned the defendant on her understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  She stated that she understood the waiver.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived her right to a preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found.

DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Parties are in negotiation.  Not resolved yet.  Request preliminary hearing  1/2 hour.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.   No contact with Carl W., no drugs or paraphernalia, must cooperate with JCHSD evaluation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defense waives reading of complaint; and waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Court reviews time limits for preliminary hearing/charges/potential penalties with defendant.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Court sets for pretrial 5-27-15 and status on 6-15-15 at 3:00.  Bond continued and defendant verifies her mailing address.
